text: Patuki Isaako is a Tokelauan political figure. ==Background and political role== Isaako is from Atafu. He was the head of government of Tokelau (Ulu o Tokelau) from February 2004 to February 2005. ===Issues=== In May 2004, the United Nations Special Committee on Decolonialization held a seminar to discuss independence for Tokelau from New Zealand. Isaako opposed the idea, mainly because Tokelau may be too small and undeveloped to function on its own. ==See also== * Politics of Tokelau ==External links== *Tokelau Wonders, "What Have We Done Wrong?" title: Patuki Isaako
